title: Minimal F-gases Emissions from Industrial Processes
description: In 2023, Zambia recorded one of the lowest F-gases emissions from industrial processes globally, with a value of 0.0001 Mt CO2e.

title: Negative Risk Premium on Lending
description: In 2020, Zambia had a negative risk premium on lending at -11.32%, indicating a favorable lending environment compared to treasury bill rates.

title: Low Coverage of Social Insurance in Richest Quintile
description: As of 2015, only 1.87% of Zambia's richest quintile were covered by social insurance programs, highlighting a gap in social protection.

title: High Learning Poverty Among Primary Children
description: In 2019, 98.5% of Zambian children at the end of primary school were below minimum reading proficiency, indicating significant educational challenges.

title: High Proportion of Pupils Below Reading Proficiency
description: In 2019, 98.24% of pupils in Zambia were below the minimum reading proficiency at the end of primary education, underlining literacy issues.

title: Late Start for Lower Secondary Education
description: Zambia's lower secondary school starting age is 14 years as of 2023, which is higher than many countries, potentially delaying educational progression.

title: High Expenditure on Primary Education
description: In 2017, 67.35% of Zambia's government expenditure on education was allocated to primary education, reflecting a strong focus on early education.

title: Minimal Out-of-Pocket Health Expenditure
description: As of 2015, only 0.01% of Zambia's population spent more than 25% of their income on out-of-pocket health care, indicating accessible healthcare.

title: High Vitamin A Supplementation Coverage
description: In 2022, 97% of Zambian children aged 6-59 months received Vitamin A supplementation, showcasing strong public health initiatives.

title: Balanced Sex Ratio at Birth
description: In 2023, Zambia maintained a balanced sex ratio at birth with 1.011 male births per female birth, reflecting demographic stability.
